>>33635013
Sun conjunct Midheaven in the natal chart is also called Sun culminating. It makes you very goal-oriented. Success in your career is one of your most important needs. You express your identity through your achievements so you work hard to make your mark. You should enjoy a good social standing and be socially popular.

Failure can be devastating for you and severely damage your self-esteem. For this reason, it is important for you to avoid the potential negatives of this aspect. You are a proud person but arrogance or egotism will cause much resistance to your goals. You have leadership qualities but may have a tendency to rebel against authority figures. For this reason, you need to pace yourself and learn to work under direction until you learn the skills necessary for success.

It is okay for you to feel important and think you are destined for great things. Just don’t rub it in people’s faces. You probably looked up to your father and will find it easier to advance if he was supportive. Learn from your elders and superiors and show them respect. In this way, you will rise to the top and earn the respect and distinction you seek. If you cannot work within a bureaucracy or be a small fish in a big pond, it would be best if you could go into business for yourself.

>>33635083
Moon conjunct Midheaven in the natal chart is also called Moon Culminating. This aspect makes you extra sensitive with powerful emotions. Events in your childhood have had a strong effect on your whole life. Early conditioning probably had a great influence, especially from your mother in helping work out what type of career you wanted. How this played out depends on how emotionally supportive she was. Depending again on your mother’s influence you probably have strong maternal instincts.

You project a warm, caring, and sympathetic image in public. You should feel comfortable in groups of people and would do well in working in front of the public. You can make people think you belong to them. You have genuine sympathy for others and would do well in a protective role caring and nurturing, even advertising or public relations.

This aspect gives psychic ability or at least a very strong intuition that guides you. You are also likely to enjoy much help in your life, especially from women. One possible downside to this favorable aspect is a tendency to be too passive or submissive in setting and following your goals. But this should only be a problem if you experienced negative reinforcement as a child, shown by a hard aspect to your Moon Midheaven conjunction from another planet.

>>33639144
Mars conjunct Midheaven natal makes you determined to do everything your own way. You are very ambitious, competitive, and great at taking the initiative. Also called Mars culminating, this aspect means you make split-minute decisions and take action very quickly, knowing just what to do. You would get angry if someone tried to stop you, very angry sometimes. You may find it a challenge, but listening to the ideas of others will help avoid arguments, even if you only pretend you are interested.

You identify yourself with your goals, career, calling, or whatever you intend to do. If anyone questions your intentions you feel like they are personally attacking you. Awareness of this tendency will help you separate yourself from your actions.

Your career should allow for independence and let you burn off a lot of physical energy. However, this does not mean you must be a soldier, steelworker, or professional athlete. Your brain burns a lot of energy during challenging mental work and anything competitive such as sales and business would suit Mars conjunct Midheaven. Working with fewer and not many people would probably suit you better.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Posting the gender of the people involved can help you get your query answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.
•Be polite.

Hexagram 63 - After Completion - Lines 1, 2, 3 > 29 abyss

http://wengu.tartarie.com/wg/wengu.php?l=Yijing&no=63

I really don't like this hex because it's more cryptic to me than most others...

First off, the hex itself. In terms of personal development, it will mean that you've finished an important step or phase. Now, what the hexagram warns is that while a new time of your life is here also will bring the new challenges that come along with it. It warns that while you've finished one thing you can get complacent and be chill and all is good. NOPE!

So the hex... the good news is, you'll be over with something, but sitting on your laurels with be a dumb mistake

Line 1: you can probaly get what I'm getting from deduction reading the text but yeah... Given this is a time of completion you might be compelled to move forward unprepared like you've got it all figured out and stuff. No you don't. It's gonna be bad.

Line 2: I'll just copy past this

>This as a rule results in office seeking. If a man's superiors withhold their trust from him, he will seek ways and means of getting it and of drawing attention to himself. We are warned against such an unworthy procedure: "Do not seek it. " Do not throw yourself away on the world, but wait tranquilly and develop your personal worth by your own efforts. Times change. When the six stages of the hexagram have passed, the new era dawns. That which is a man's own cannot be permanently lost. It comes to him of its own accord. He need only be able to wait.

Line 3: I can interpret this as you being in this time in your personal development to clear out and chase down all the bad stuff in your life and within you. That's the good bit. In After completion mode you are in a positon to do that, more than you would let's say, face new challenges.

hope this helps

Hexagram 31 - Influence - 3, 4 > 8

Right off the bat, seems like you're trying too hard to attract a guy, make him love you that kind of stuff that might have the opposite effect. The image is one of the water sitting still on the lake atop the mountain. Think of your mind as the mountain which is tranquil and still and the emptiness of your thoughts is the place where rainwater can fill up to form a lake, which is what comes from the outside.

Line 3 and 4 warns of your urge to make a move and just lack of stability. Stop thinking you actually have to make moves and wonder which step you're at, and what it is you have to do. wonder if you're just dating, if you gotta precipitate the next phase, does it has to come from you or from him?

The resulting hex is 20, which is interesting to me, and very insightful. Just watch things play out. Don't get in the way of your own mating process. We living creatures have circuits meant for mating that knows what to do and how. Be a spectator to your own love story rather than being swayed into all sorts of directions and being made to do dumb things out of stupid consideration and instability of character.

Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a wizard named Anon who was known for his ability to control the weather. Anon was a mischievous wizard who loved nothing more than causing chaos and causing trouble for the people around him.

One winter, Anon decided that he would create a storm so fierce that it would cripple the economy of the Great Lakes region. He knew that the people there relied heavily on the transportation of goods across the lakes, and he wanted to see just how much havoc he could wreak with his magical powers.

Anon spent weeks preparing for the storm, gathering all of the necessary ingredients and performing the spells that would give him control over the weather. Finally, when everything was ready, he cast his spell and summoned a massive winter storm that blanketed the region in snow and ice.

The storm was so severe that it froze the lakes solid, preventing any ships from crossing. The economy came to a standstill as goods could not be transported, and many businesses were forced to close their doors. The people of the Great Lakes region were left struggling to survive in the harsh winter conditions.

Despite the chaos that he had caused, Anon couldn't help but laugh at the disaster he had created. He loved nothing more than causing trouble, and he especially loved his favorite food: tendies. He spent the entire winter feasting on his beloved tendies, delighting in the misery of those around him.

Eventually, the winter storm passed, and the Great Lakes region slowly began to recover. But the people there never forgot the wicked wizard Anon and the havoc he had caused with his winter storm.

"The essential characteristic of the Grade is that its possessor utters a Creative Magical Word, which transforms the planet on which he lives by the installation of new officers to preside over its initiation. This can take place only at an “Equinox of the Gods” at the end of an “Aeon”; that is, when the secret formula which expresses the Law of its action becomes outworn and useless to its further development."
~Crowley, One Star in Sight

"The other form of Thoth represents him primarily as Wisdom and the Word. He bears in his right hand the Style, in his left the Papyrus. He is the messenger of the gods; he transmits their will by hieroglyphs intelligible to the initiate, and records their acts; but it was seen from very early times that the use of speech, or writing, meant the introduction of ambiguity at the best, and falsehood at the worst; they therefore represented Thoth as followed by an ape, the cynocephalus, whose business was to distort the Word of the god; to mock, to simulate and to deceive. In philosophical language one may say: Manifestation implies illusion. This doctrine is found in Hindu philosophy, where the aspect of Tahuti of which we are speaking is called Mayan. This doctrine is also found in the central and typical image of the Mahayana school of Buddhism (really identical with the doctrine of Shiva and Shakti)."
~Crowley, The Book of Thoth

"The reflection of the sun (human consciousness) in the waters of the abyss is thus symbolized by Thoth and his cynocephalus as the man and his dog reflected in the moon. The cynocephalus or dog-headed ape utters the Word of the Magus (HaditChokmah) in reverse. Frater Achad had an inkling of these mysteries and it led him to enunciate his Formula of Reversion."
~Kenneth Grant, Nightside of Eden.

Mars is a highly valuable strategic location.
If you're traveling from the inner solar system to the outer solar system or beyond, and vice versa, Mars is the gateway. A space truck-stop, if you will.
Enough gravity to be useful, but not so much it's too expensive to launch from.
In other words, if your enemy is in the inner solar system, and you want to cut off their access to the rest of it, you'd hit Mars, or the other way around, if you were trying to hold this solar system from an outside force, and were getting pushed back and trapped in the inner solar system, you'd hit Mars.
Earth isn't a blasted wasteland, so I'm assuming it was the latter, and it was successful.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33656806
I'm not familiar with either's work too much, but I'll speak from my experience.
>detailing the steps vs living in the end
The way I learned it, you do the latter first, and if it looks like there's no progress after a few weeks, you break the end goal into smaller steps, then accomplish those steps.

Like, if you're trying to get $1000 for free, but it's not happening, you could do things like breaking it down into $500, and try to manifest that twice in succession.
>Don't take action at all; it will come to you.
Is this actually what he says? I thought what he says is "don't put in effort", which is not the same thing as not taking action. The way I learned it, has to do with what you're manifesting. Like if it's something that you're accomplishing, then you go through the motions, but you don't "try", you specifically frame it as if it's super-easily done, and you don't worry about mistakes. If it's something that you want to "get", then it doesn't matter what you do. You don't "have" to ignore any signs of getting that object, but regardless of whether you do or not, you will get it (like, you might be searching for something rare, and then you find it while you go out shopping, or you could just stay at home for a week but then one of your friends will tell you that they're giving the thing you want as a gift or something).

>thinking often vs forgetting about it
Neville says something similar about being stubborn if I recall, but Neville's take in your post is more accurate I'd say. The way I'd break it down is to have a daily practice on manifesting what you want (visualization, affirmations, whatever), but ignore any news that goes against your desire, and wipe out any worries about it. You keep this up until you have assurance that you'll get what you want, which should be the same feeling as knowing that the sun will come up every single morning. Still, you can get your desire even before forgetting about it.

>>33659245
>Can't move anything and the auto breathe function is off.
Well, ackshually. Breathing is one of the few processes which work both consciously and unconsciously in the body. When you're in sleep paralysis, your conscious breathing mechanism is inhibited because your whole body's conscious moving mechanism (skeletal muscle) is paralyzed.
When you find that you can't breathe in sleep paralysis it's because your attention has gone to the breathing and snatched control from the autonomic processes that would be normally making you breathe. Your automatic ability to breathe is not impeded. You're blocking it by being too aware of your breathing, like in the old 4chan meme.
>you are now breathing consciously
Once you are aware of it, it's very difficult to revert this state. But it is not impossible. I've done it many times. Of course, the more you obsess over it, the worse off you will be.

Just know that your body will take care of it and focus on whatever it is you want to do in that state.

posts.com:
Santa denial is the ultimate result of a society that has reached its apex of rationalism and intellectualism, while concurrently burying its spiritual and ritualistic side of itself. We live in an Apollonian age of numbers, results, capital, etc. and it is killing the side of ourselves that believes in anything - this naturally leads to nihilism and bleakness. The same nihilism and bleakness that presides over the entirety of our culture today. This is why you don't see any great works of art anymore.

A Santa Denier is the man who deems himself intellectual for believing in the "science"; yet, has this man done his own research? He believes in molecules, yet has he seen them for himself under a microscope? I say, "NO". He was merely told this was the case from some book, or from some teacher. So, here, we see, this intellectual man is just as vulnerable to belief systems as anyone else.

William James backs me up in his essay, "The Will to Believe":
>"Yet if any one should thereupon assume that intellectual insight is what remains after wish and will and sentimental preference have taken wing, or that pure reason is what then settles our opinions, he would fly quite as directly in the teeth of the facts."

Santa IS real, because we believe him to be; it is as simple as that. When you see a present under the tree that says "From: Santa", that is all the proof you need.

I finish my essay with a question:
Walking through the mall are two people,
1.) A small child who just sat on Santa's lap and told him of their wishes, and is fully content after having participated in ritual and tradition. They fully believe that this Santa will fulfill all of their wishes.
2.) The smirking intellectual, who "knows" in his head that Santa is not real, and thinks that this child is naïve - yet he participates in the tradition, gift bags in hand, supporting the corporations and 1% he claims to hate.

Who is happier?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

Lately when I sit down and meditate I feel like the stakes are really high... in terms of what I'm thinking about. It's been hard to relax.

Sometimes I'm worrying if I'm having a negative influence on my thinking by meditating too much, or maybe I'm doing it in a wrong way, but then I remember it's all about relaxation and getting back to central one-ness.

I am not a strict buddhist or anything, the dogma of it is not important, but I think regardless of whatever cult people are into, really cultivating focus in the mind is an important thing.

I haven't really had love in a long time, so I think in my advancing age it might be best to focus on the particulars of ordinary life and that's pretty much all I have to say.

It's important to me that humans learn how to communicate well and do their best to love each other. So congratulations if you are able to achieve that with the people around you.

Yeah I do that all the time.
But "focus" may be misleading, as a word it can mean that you focus on 1 thing 100% (used here as a verb and it's more of a "doing" thing which is not very meditative for me)

But I think that the focus someone achieves during meditation is the focus which is grammatically used as a noun or adjective, I'd call it the "focus state" in which you are attentive and whole without having any preference towards an object.

Picking an object during meditation can be tricky, yes you can focus on a tree during walking meditation but you don't get absorbed by some kind of story involving that tree, you just watch the tree and see it clearly for what it is.

And what it is? Just a part of the whole.

>>33633518
Monk anon here. Meditation is a tool to understand the nature of the mind. To train ourselves to see things as they really are. It's really that simple. The reason we suffer so much is because we don't understand the nature of the mind. We don't realize how conditioned we are, the conditioning is the basis for stress and anxiety. When we watch the mind for a long enough time, we begin to understand it, we begin to notice the habitual patterns. We notice how external stimuli aren't the real cause of our anger, for example. The problem isn't that something is what it is, the problem is that we don't want it to be that way, or want it to be some other way. We learn that we're actually creating our own problems when we could just let it go. We learn that we aren't our thoughts. Thoughts are just there, the problems begin when we identify with and take them personally as "these thoughts are me." Ultimately, your mind and thoughts are working against you, until you can break the conditioning and snap out of these delusions. This actually takes more work than anyone here is willing to do. Many people see "meditation" as a quick self help fix or relaxation technique, bit they won't have any meaningful or long lasting results from their efforts. Meditation has to be developed along side morality and wisdom. It's a tripod and none will work without the others. This means that probably 99.9% of people are wasting their time with meditation, because most people can't or simply won't bother with the morality and wisdom aspect. They aren't willing to let go completely.

>>3364053
For morality? Pick a religious/spiritual/occult/philosophical school of thought with a moral code that genuinely resonates with you and start living it. The Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes are similarly very straight forward and easy to grasp without requiring any mental gymnastics to avoid hypocrisy. Morality really isn't as complicated as modern religious culture makes it out to be. Don't harm yourself or others. Don't help others harm themselves. Provide help when requested. Don't offer help or advice when not qualified or requested. I.E.
>"love" (commit to the well being of) your neighbors
Morality in a nutshell. Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes break it down slightly more clearly since Christ's proverb is apparently very easy to misunderstand. Same idea though.

For wisdom? There are countless ways. This mostly just requires life experience, reflection, and empathy. Meditating daily and bringing your baseline conscious experience closer and closer to a meditative state is a slow but reliable method. You'll be well ahead of the curve if you are able to fully comprehend and live this old Buddhist proverb:
>I am a finger pointed at the moon
>do not look at me, look at the moon
The truth is everywhere in plain sight. Look for the truth in everything, not the lies in everything.

>>33648519
It's kinda strange to explain it.
Most people nowadays live in their thinking minds, they don't live in the here and now and they only live through a lens of thinking which dictates their being, they usually think about the past and the future more than the here and now.

Feeling something is an entirely different thing from thinking, you may feel fear but you may think hateful thoughts, you may feel happiness but you may think that happiness is wrong.

I used to be an over-thinking person with an overactive mind, I'd analyze anything, I'd daydream all day long e.t.c.

Turning off my mind was scary for me, feeling my feelings was scary for me, I hated feeling anything (be it happiness, fear, sorrow) because I thought that I couldn't handle those feelings.

I remember when I began meditating, I was focusing on my breath but most of the time I was just thinking about my breath or me about focusing on the breath, or I was thinking about the feelings my breath left on my body, it took me some time to just FEEL my breath.

I still haven't answered your question and truth be told I don't have a solid answer, the closer I can get to is this: Feeling is one of your abilities, just how thinking is, just don't try to analyze/think about feeling because that is not feeling, feeling is just feeling something, there is no "wrong" or "right" feeling. Society teaches that it's "wrong" to feel sadness or sorrow or anger, those are just thought-words that others taught you, THERE IS NO WRONG FEELING, there is only feeling.
And lastly: Feeling only happens in the here and now, so I'd say that feeling is a more "grounded" ability than thinking.

I hope what I said makes some sense, if not ask me again.

I'm late to the party but here's what you do. Sit crossed legged or in a chair with your back straight. Put your attention gently on the breath. Don't intensely force your attention to stay on it. Eventually you will notice your mind is wandering. Take a brief moment to acknowledge this and return your attention to the breath. If it helps, you can mentally says "in" and "out" as you breathe in and out, or "beginning" and "end" to mark the beginning and end of each in and out breath.

This is the starting technique in >>33643926 which I also highly recommend reading.

I found a book - called "Murder at Golgotha" - which explains it quite clearly

"the Romans were ever a practical people. As known from the writings of Roman historians, the prescribed procedure was for the victim to carry only the patibulum, or crossbeam of the cross.The stipes, or upright—usually a beheaded tree-trunk still rooted in the ground—remained permanently in position, so that the crossbeam carried by the victim could simply be lifted up and dropped into position for each fresh execution"

Jesus wasn't nailed to any cross, nor did he ever carry one on his back
he carried a crossbeam on his back, and said crossbeam was then hanged from a tree

One day, a group of friends were browsing the internet and stumbled upon a strange website. It was a forum for discussing ancient mythology and folklore, and the group was immediately drawn in by the intriguing discussions and theories being shared.

As they delved deeper into the forum, they came across a thread that caught their attention. It was titled "The Legend of the Cursed Scroll," and it told the story of a ancient text that was said to bring great power and knowledge to whoever possessed it.

The friends were fascinated by the legend and couldn't resist the temptation to try and track down the cursed scroll. They spent hours searching online and eventually discovered that the scroll was rumored to be hidden in a remote mountain temple in Tibet.

Determined to find the scroll, the friends set off on a journey to Tibet. After a long and treacherous journey, they finally arrived at the temple and began searching for the scroll. They eventually found it hidden away in a hidden chamber, guarded by a group of monks who had protected it for centuries.

The friends were overjoyed to have found the cursed scroll, and they couldn't wait to see what secrets it held. As they unrolled the ancient text, they were amazed by the knowledge and power that it contained. They knew that they had stumbled upon something truly special and unique, and they vowed to keep the scroll safe and protect its secrets from the outside world.

From that day on, the friends were never the same. They had discovered something truly incredible on the internet, and they knew that they would always be searching for the next great mystery or adventure.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

Want to thank you guys for posting these techniques, using them I've been able to have my second lucid dream. First time was years ago and completely spontaneous. It was a lot of fun and one of the most surreal things I've experienced but I had no clue how to reproduce it. Using the MILD method I finally had a success a few nights ago.

>It's overcast, I'm standing in the street
>groups of people passing me by
>dreambrain decides I should start running sprints in the road
>go into starter position, hand on the ground but whenever I try to run my feet slip
>my legs are churning but I just start floating until I drop back down
>try two more times, each time no traction just floating up then back down
>a couple walks past me
>guy says to girl, 'yeah I want to hang out but I can't cause I think I might be dreaming'
>wait if he's dreaming how do I know I'm not dreaming?
>realitycheck.exe
>shit I'm dreaming
>fully lucid I take off flying
>feel electricity surging through every cell of my body, powering me
>I'm starting to break through the haze above me
>suddenly hear my voice boom from the clouds
>"YOU ARE A LOST SOUL"
>the electricity is now paralyzing
>muscles locked in place
>I'm plummeting
>wake up right before I hit the ground

Anyways thanks for these threads, looking forward to having my next session

On February 22nd, 2017, an image purportedly showing an alien was posted to 4chan titled “24489 Taken Aprox 24 miles north west of Luke Air Force Base Phoenix Az. Lab H4C” . That morning, several Cloudflare servers went down, leading to 4chan going offline.

That day, a 4chan user submitted a thread to /pol/ saying they heard “something about an alien being posted before the site went down.
Meanwhile, a Pastebin page was created with relevant links and information about the alien photograph post. Also on February 22nd, various 4chan posts were created claiming that the image was being covered up by the government.

On February 23rd, RedditorGrizzlepash submitted a post to /r/conspiracyclaiming that alien posts were being “aggresively censored” on 4chan boards.

Something I captured years ago and uploaded to youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1i9ZygpBeVE&t=88s
There are two parts to the video. The second half is also on the same channel.

I'm a skeptic when it comes to UFOs, and I tried to rule out what it could be.

I found the nearest military bases, RSP bases, and armories but they all were several towns away. I also called the local PD and sportsmans clubs, but nothing was conducted of the sort. I took it to buddies of mine in the Airforce, and they concluded it wasn't any sort of flare drill.

I doubt its a drone because one, there wasn't any blinking light on it for other aircraft to recognize. So it was a drone, it was flown illegally. Two, whatever those objects were, they were touching low cloud coverage (which is why the objects appear to blink or go dark at random times in the video. I had a crappy android and as you may know, they suck at taking video). The general legal limit for how high one can fly a drone is 400ft, however these objects were way higher.

These objects were certainly under intelligent control. The were making linear and geometric shapes in the air (line, triangles, etc) and stopped, started, rose, descended, and decreased/increased speed several times; some of which were apparent in the video.

Now I know if you release a flock of balloons, they can catch an air current and move together in unison, but not all of the three objects were in sync. They wouldn't have been LED balloons of Chinese lanterns because of how bright they were. It would be the equivalent of putting a streetlight all the way up in the clouds.

The video I uploaded has no audio (My friend and I were cursing a lot) but if anyone wants the audio version I can provide it. The crafts were dead silent. I'm also in the military and I can conclude that they also weren't silent aircraft such as blackhawks. I ran this by an aviation unit I'm well acquainted with and they also confirmed this.

posts.com:
A gnome destroyed my life. Ever since my first "gnoming," I've had a strange fondness for the little guy. He always seemed so happy, scampering into frame and playing his little pranks. But eventually, my patience began to wear thin. I would see him in EVERY comment section, always lurking amid walls of text to fool me yet again. After a while, I started to lose sleep. I would go days without eating, for fear that I would see him, staring around the corner while I made a sandwich.I stopped leaving my room. I became a recluse, only leaving my apartment to buy groceries. And then came the day that I saw him. Standing in the aisle at Walmart, examining the candy section. I was stunned. Floored, even. He turned to me, and opened his mouth. I don't remember what exactly happened. All I knew was that I couldn't let him deliver his mocking diatribe.I couldn't let him gnome me. Next thing I remember, I'm standing in the cutlery aisle, soaked in blood. At my feet lies the corpse of the "gnome" - an innocent ten year old boy, clad in green. I've been running for the past ten hours. I stopped at a gas station outside of Lancaster to fuel up, and hit the road again. Once I reach Las Vegas, I'm going to lay low, rack up some savings, and head east. Start a new life somewhere else. Sometimes, when I close my eyes, I can see him. The gnome stares at me from the darkness, daring me to return, to pay for my crimes. A single tear runs down my cheek, and I realize the truth.

I was being gnomed from the start.

Thread 404'd, didn't realize there was a general on, so, re-posting:

Gentlemen, I now officially believe in gnomes.
Ever since I've started reading about them, my gnomish encounters have skyrocketed.

Just today, I keep my toothpaste in the bathroom, right?
Of course, it'd be the most obvious that it'd be on the counter - where I leave it every single day.

Well, today, it wasn't there.
Now, you might say, "well, someone might have moved it" - very true; however, I was in the bathroom, locked, by myself, when I took my morning shower, so nobody could have come in or out.

My toothpaste was still missing, and I'd been looking for it the entire time I was there - after giving up, as I mentioned, I went to take my shower.
When I came out, it's right there, in the middle of the fucking counter.

Now, I actually like gnomes, but this is an unprecedented degree of mischief that I'd just not seen before.
This is the least mystical of my recent experiences, but consider me officially gnomepilled.
I bet there's one in my fucking computer right now, and in the walls.
Thankfully, as a Slav, we consider house spirits to be friendly, and take care not to upset them, so I hope my standing with the gnomes is good.

I'll at least, give you an Honest answer.
This is a partial solution that's just a little short of dong magick, and it's a meditation that's similar to self-hypnosis.
It's simple enough, but it avoids killing off the Ego by starving it to death; therefore there is NO mantra. You can do relaxation on your body first. Concentrate on your feet and tense your legs and then let them relax then move that tension/relaxation wave upwards toward your head relaxing your whole body completely.
Close your eyes and concentrate on your right hand. When you do this you should feel it tingle. Briefly concentrate on your whole body and it should tingle as well as this is your body sense. As thoughts come up just *watch* them somewhat dispassionately, and when you start to drift away from the concentration gently bring back your attention to your hand again. Don't judge or try to change anything, just observe your thoughts. As you watch them Things will slowly be resolved - it takes some time. When you get lost in thoughts, gently bring your attention back to your right hand again. The hardest part is dealing with the damn music! You've memorized more than you know, and it all comes up to distract you. When you close your eyes it isn't completely dark; there are "lights" there. Bring your attention to them and concentrate on them. Sometimes concentrate on your right hand and forehead and "see" the hand in your mind moving to your forehead of what seems to be its own volition. Eventually, it should go there. It also helps reduce roof-brain chatter. Make it a daily practice and thank Roy Masters (deceased)...

posts.com:
As an adolescent child, my father worked days, sometimes 10-12 hour ones, and my mom worked nights, also sometimes for 10-12 hours. I was homeschooled, so this gave me a huge opening in my time where they couldn't supervise me on the "family computer" which they never used and they never cared enough to look into getting parental blockers.
As a result, I was exposed to the absolute blackest, most depraved and sick parts of the surface web, especially in reference to sex.
I ended up making friends with other deviants and my whole sexual development as a teenager was dominated by a myriad of male and female characters and cartoons, in all sorts of fetishistic degenerate situations.
